content.user_title: Analyze single cell omics with scvi-tools
content.value_statement: Single cell datasets are noisy and hard to integrate across batches and modalities. This skill provides guidance on scvi-tools workflows for probabilistic modeling, batch correction, differential expression, and multimodal integration.
actual_capabilities: Explain scVI and scANVI workflows for batch correction and cell type annotation
Guide setup_anndata, model training, and latent representation extraction
Detail differential_expression parameters and result interpretation
Describe ATAC-seq model usage for PeakVI and PoissonVI
Outline spatial workflows such as DestVI deconvolution and Tangram mapping
Provide multimodal integration guidance for totalVI and MultiVI
limitations: Does not execute scvi-tools or install packages
Requires AnnData inputs with raw counts for most models
Cannot validate biological conclusions from analysis results
GPU usage depends on local hardware and setup

use_cases.title: Batch corrected scRNA-seq
use_cases.description: Plan scVI setup, covariates, and downstream clustering for multi-batch scRNA-seq integration.

use_cases.title: Multimodal integration
use_cases.description: Design MultiVI or totalVI workflows for paired and unpaired RNA and protein data analysis.

use_cases.title: Spatial deconvolution
use_cases.description: Apply DestVI or Stereoscope to map cell types from scRNA-seq reference onto spatial transcriptomics spots.

prompt_templates.title: Start with scVI
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the steps to set up AnnData, train scVI, and extract a latent space for clustering. Include key parameters.

prompt_templates.title: Run differential expression
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to run differential_expression between two cell types and how to interpret lfc_mean and bayes_factor.

prompt_templates.title: Integrate RNA and ATAC
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a MultiVI plan for mixed paired and unpaired RNA and ATAC data, including modality keys.

prompt_templates.title: Map cells to space
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe a DestVI workflow using a scRNA-seq reference to deconvolve Visium spots and visualize cell type proportions.

output_examples.input: I need a plan to integrate two scRNA-seq batches and run differential expression between cell types.
output: Use raw counts stored in a layer and register batch and covariates with setup_anndata
Train scVI model and extract a batch-corrected latent representation
Cluster on the latent space and identify cell type groups
Run differential_expression for selected groups and review effect sizes like lfc_mean and bayes_factor

best_practices: Keep raw counts in a layer and register covariates like batch before training
Validate batch correction visually with UMAP colored by batch and cell type
Save trained models for reuse and reproducibility across sessions
anti_patterns: Training on log-normalized data instead of raw counts
Ignoring batch or donor covariates during setup_anndata
Interpreting small effect sizes as strong biology without using delta thresholds

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: It targets scvi-tools workflows and integrates with scanpy and AnnData conventions for single-cell analysis.

faq.question: What are the limits of the guidance?
faq.answer: It provides instructions and parameter recommendations but does not run models or produce results.

faq.question: Can it help with integration across modalities?
faq.answer: Yes, it covers totalVI for CITE-seq and MultiVI for RNA and ATAC integration patterns.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it only provides guidance through documentation and does not access files or send data.

faq.question: What if training fails with NaN loss?
faq.answer: Check that input uses raw counts, lower the learning rate, and validate all values are non-negative.

faq.question: How does scvi-tools compare to Seurat integration?
faq.answer: scvi-tools uses probabilistic VAE models with batch-aware modeling which can improve uncertainty handling.
